intro: Cardamine fargesiana, commonly known as the Farges' watercress, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
